channel.title: Bxg7 Pentesting Docs

item.title: Session Management Intro
item.description: Since HTTP is a stateless protocol (meaning if you send two requests to the same server, it has no idea it came from the same user) the idea of the session came along. The session is basically just an object kept in memory by the Web Application so that it can identify each user. After the initial request from a user the server will reply back with the session ID and every time a new request comes in from that same user the assigned ID will be in the request.
